The weighed glucose is transferred into the weighing bottle.
Weighing bottle containing glucose is again weighed and the net weight is noted.

Shake well for mixing these two solutions.
Label it as “Fehling’s solution”.
From that a small amount is taken using a clean pipette and the pipette is rinsed using that solution.
From that a small amount is taken using a clean pipette and the pipette is rinsed using that solution.

notext
Pipette 20ml of this freshly prepared Fehling’s solution into a 250ml standard flask.

20ml distilled water were also pipetted and transferred into the same conical flask.

notext
Shake well.
The solution is boiled gently over wire gauze up to 70°C.
The solution is boiled gently over wire gauze up to 70°C.

The standard glucose solution from the burette is run slowly (not more than 1ml at a time) into the boiling Fehling’s solution until the blue colour has completely disappeared and a red precipitate settles down.
Detection of End Point Accurately.
Pipette 20ml Fehling’s solution using a clean pipette into the 250ml conical flask.
Pipette 20ml Fehling’s solution using a clean pipette into the 250ml conical flask.
Pipette 20ml Fehling’s solution using a clean pipette into the 250ml conical flask.
Pipette 20ml distilled water using a clean pipette and transfer into the same 250ml conical flask containing 20ml Fehling’s solution.
Pipette 20ml distilled water using a clean pipette and transfer into the same 250ml conical flask containing 20ml Fehling’s solution.
notext
Shake well for mixing.

notext
The solution is boiled gently over wire gauze.
The solution is boiled gently over wire gauze.
Add glucose solution from the burette in one stretch into the boiling Fehling’s solution until it reaches the end point (Blue colour just fades).
To note the end point more accurately 2-3 drops of methylene blue indicator is added to Fehling’s solution.
To note the end point more accurately 2-3 drops of methylene blue indicator is added to Fehling’s solution.
To note the end point more accurately 2-3 drops of methylene blue indicator is added to Fehling’s solution.
notext
Continue the titration till the blue colour completely disappears and the red precipitate is obtained. This is the accurate end point.
